quest.name: The Search for Sicard
journal: Alphinaud has the look of a man with a plan.
objectives: Speak with Alphinaud at Oschon's Embrace.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Do you remember how Alphinaud pretended to be some manner of merchant to infiltrate Eulmore? Well, I bet you ten gil he's about to reprise the role.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: If Alphinaud's theory proves well founded, it would go some way to explaining the Executioners' vehement opposition to peace.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: During my inquiries, a disgruntled merchant informed me that a wholesaler of crystals had recently arrived in Limsa Lominsa, offering wares at prices far undercutting the competition.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: After asking around, I was able to gain an introduction, and will shortly pose as a potential buyer, in a bid to establish the crystals' provenance.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The man is due to be at Oschon's Embrace in lower La Noscea shortly. I suggest we make our way there at once.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: That appears to be our merchant. Wish me luck...

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Wait. If he truly is in league with the Bloody Executioners, he will surely be wary of those allied to the Admiral─the Scions not least of all.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Compared to yours and Forename's, mine is an unfamiliar face. Let me play the role of buyer.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: G'raha is right. And even if you aren't recognized on sight, you look too genteel to be mixing with society's underbelly.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Genteel...? But very well. I leave it you, G'raha.

dialogue.name: SUSPICIOUSMERCHANT
dialogue.text: Got business with me, catboy?

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: I─ Ahem. You're the crystal wholesaler?

dialogue.name: SUSPICIOUSMERCHANT
dialogue.text: That I am. But you're no merchant. So what do you want the crystals for?

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Um... I, er...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: (Don't look at us, you idiot! You'll give yourself away!)

dialogue.name: SUSPICIOUSMERCHANT
dialogue.text: Ohhh, I see. You're a weaponsmith, am I right? And you need crystals to make staffs like that fine specimen you've got there.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Th-That's right! I am indeed a weaponsmith, and I use naught but the finest materials. I bid you show me your wares.

dialogue.name: SUSPICIOUSMERCHANT
dialogue.text: Well, we don't invite just anybody into our storehouses. Takes time to establish trust, you understand.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Look, I have a large and urgent commission. If the quality is satisfactory, I will not quibble over the price.

dialogue.name: SUSPICIOUSMERCHANT
dialogue.text: ...All right. It's plain that's no ordinary crystal adornin' your staff. So I'll make an exception. Come with me.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: It...seems to be working. Let's follow them.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Given how long he spent playing the Crystal Exarch, you'd think G'raha would be a better actor.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Honestly, if it hadn't been for that staff... We must remember to thank Tataru.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: They went into that tunnel. Quietly, now...

dialogue.name: SUSPICIOUSMERCHANT
dialogue.text: You won't find any finer. 'Specially not for the price.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Indeed. I would expect to pay more than double for such quality. How could they possibly be so cheap?

dialogue.name: SUSPICIOUSMERCHANT
dialogue.text: There's nothin' unlawful about 'em, if that's your worry. They're from O'Ghomoro, if you take my meanin'.

dialogue.name: SUSPICIOUSMERCHANT
dialogue.text: Stuff's as pure as it gets─you won't be disappointed. So...how much d'you want?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: O'Ghomoro. Taken from the kobolds, just as we suspected.

dialogue.name: SICARD
dialogue.text: (-???-)That's enough. Shut your gobs and turn around. Slowly.

dialogue.name: SICARD
dialogue.text: I'm Sicard, actin' captain of the Bloody Executioners.

dialogue.name: SICARD
dialogue.text: No need to introduce yourselves. We know who you are...Scions.

dialogue.name: SICARD
dialogue.text: And we also know you've been chattin' to the Admiral. Got eyes and ears everywhere, see. Comes with bein' the only true pirate crew left in Limsa.

dialogue.name: SICARD
dialogue.text: So we've established you ain't here to buy crystals. The question is: what are you here for?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: You are bold to reveal yourself to us without knowing our objective. But that would explain your swift rise to power.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: You have spoken plain, and so I shall return the favor. We came here to learn why the Bloody Executioners oppose the Admiral's will.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: And we have our answer. Should Limsa Lominsa make peace with the kobolds, you would lose the source of your newfound wealth.

dialogue.name: SICARD
dialogue.text: That's right. Just to remind you, though, we ain't breakin' any rules here.

dialogue.name: SICARD
dialogue.text: The law forbids us from attackin' any vessel not flyin' the imperial flag, but it don't say nothin' about beastmen.

dialogue.name: SICARD
dialogue.text: Only reason we keep our operation nice and quiet's 'cause we don't want no one takin' our business.

dialogue.name: SICARD
dialogue.text: Wait. Just listen to the end, will you? For what it's worth, I have the highest respect for you and yours─herhim especially.

dialogue.name: SICARD
dialogue.text: While the Maelstrom were worryin' about dirtyin' their fancy red clobber, you lot stormed U'Ghamaro and battered bleedin' Titan himself. Raised a mug to you when I heard the news!

dialogue.name: SICARD
dialogue.text: And now we're followin' in your footsteps, makin' sure the beastmen never summon their stinkin' gods again. Practically your successors, we are.

dialogue.name: SICARD
dialogue.text: When there were still imperial ships about, we did our bit for Limsa and went after 'em. But with the Garleans gone, there's no one left to ply our trade on 'cept the beastmen. So let us have that, eh? It's only fair.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: ...Contentious though some may find your views, it is true that you have broken no laws.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: That being so, I see no reason why you should not state your case directly to the Admiral's face. Unless the acting captain of the only true pirate crew left in Limsa Lominsa has some other cause to hide in a cave?

dialogue.name: SICARD
dialogue.text: Hmph. Well said. Well said indeed...

dialogue.name: SICARD
dialogue.text: All right. I'll meet with the Admiral. I'll even provide the venue─the Astalicia. I trust she won't turn down the invitation.
